intro: Bradburya glabra, commonly known as the smooth bradburya, is a species of flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen rosette of fleshy, blue-green leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale purple flowers during the spring and summer months. Bradburya glabra is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soil. Its unique morphology and drought tolerance make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
